New Records: Karl-Anthony Towns had 27 points and 13 rebounds
Key Match Events: New York led 91-81 with 9:22 left in the fourth quarter after a basket from Barnes and followed with a 15-0 run during a five-minute stretch in which the Raptors missed eight shots and had two turnovers
Pre-Game Insights: Karl-Anthony Towns shot 9 for 14 from the field, including 3 for 3 on 3-pointers, in 34 minutes after missing Monday's loss against Orlando due to patellar tendinopathy in his right knee
Post-Match Reflections: The Knicks snapped a three-game losing streak that followed nine consecutive victories
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks shot 55% from the field and got 40 combined points from Towns, Anunoby and Hart to head into halftime with a 55-51 lead
The Knicks have won their last seven meetings against Toronto dating back to last season
Others: RJ Barrett had 16 points for the Raptors
Mikal Bridges had 10 points as all five Knicks starters scored in double digits
Scottie Barnes had 18 points for the Raptors
Immanuel Quickley scored 22 points against his former team
